body.description: MDD (MD16TBGSA25672DVR) 16TB 256MB Cache 7200RPM SATA 6.0Gb/s 3.5" Internal Hard Drive designed for heavy duty 24/7 operation. It is perfect for Surveillance System, CCTV DVR & Desktop computers (PC/MAC). The MaxDigitalData 16TB hard drive provides an enormous 16TB capacity, 256MB Cache and 7200rpm rotation speed to deliver a greater level of power efficiency and quiet operation for energy-conscious, environmentally-friendly computers. 16TB of capacity to store up to 16,000 hours of HD video (depends on CCTV System.) Built for Surveillance system Heavy workloads? No problem. Smooth Video record & playback always Designed for heavy duty 24×7 operation

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Reliable Workhorse for Your Data Storage Needs
reviews.reviewText: I recently upgraded my desktop setup with the MDD MAXDIGITALDATA 16 TB hard drive, and I've been thoroughly impressed with its performance. As someone who deals with heavy workloads and needs a dependable storage solution, this hard drive has exceeded my expectations.Built for the Long Haul: What stands out the most is its design for heavy-duty 24x7 operation. I've been using it in my desktop PC for a mix of tasks, including video editing, large data backups, and as part of my RAID setup. It's been handling everything like a champ, with smooth video record and playback that hasn't missed a beat.Reliability You Can Count On: The drive boasts the industry's highest reliability with a 7200-RPM speed, designed for continuous operation. Its MTBF (Mean Time Between Failures) of 2.0M hours and AFR (Annualized Failure Rate) of 0.44% give me peace of mind, knowing that it's less likely to fail when I need it most.Versatile Compatibility: I appreciate that it's compatible with Desktop PCs/Macs, RAID systems, NAS network storage, and even CCTV DVR surveillance systems. This versatility means I can use it across different devices without worrying about compatibility issues.Installation and Setup: The drive comes as a bare drive only, which means no screws, cables, or accessories are included. While some might see this as a downside, I found it to be a non-issue since I already had the necessary components for installation. Remember to format the HDD on your system to ensure it's detected and shows up correctly.Warranty and Support: The 3-year warranty from the reseller adds an extra layer of confidence in my purchase. Knowing that I can get a full refund if anything goes wrong is reassuring, though given its solid performance so far, I doubt I'll need to use it.Final Thoughts: The MDD MAXDIGITALDATA 16 TB hard drive is a silver bullet for anyone in need of a large, reliable storage solution. Whether you're a professional dealing with heavy workloads or a tech enthusiast looking for smooth performance and reliability, this hard drive is a solid choice. Its performance, coupled with the warranty and support, makes it a valuable addition to any setup.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this drive for additional storage for my plex server, The first one I bought was lost in the mail and this replacment for that one. I had bought one back in december that was working fine until just after The first of the year and is going out. This was where I was going to transfer my data to to send the other one back for replacment. I got it all hooked up and nothing just makes the computer beep i/o error and locks it up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far so good
reviews.reviewText: two weeks in my NVR working quietly seems promising. Lets give it a year, I will update again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought these for additional storage for a future NAS. I almost just put them in the project closet. They were a great deal. To good to be true. I purchased 3, and NONE of them spun up. Just sat there and ticked. returned to amazon. i will pay a higher price for the security of a new drive
